ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.2_0: At that time the nun Caṇḍakāḷī was quarreling, arguing, and creating legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.3_0: But when a legal procedure was being done against her, the nun Thullanandā objected.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.4_0: Soon afterwards when Thullanandā went to a village on some business,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.6_0: took the opportunity to eject Caṇḍakāḷī for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.7_0: When Thullanandā had finished her business in that village, she returned to Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.8_0: As she was approaching, Caṇḍakāḷī neither prepared a seat for her, nor set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, or water for washing the feet;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.9_0: after coming out to meet him, he took his bowl and robe,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.11_0: why she was acting like this.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.12_0: having gone out to meet him to receive his bowl and robe, he asked the water for drinking.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.13_0: She replied, “That’s how it is, Venerable, when you don’t have a protector.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.14_0: “But how is it, Venerable, that you don’t have a protector?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.16_0: that no-one would speak up for me because I am not esteemed by them and I didn’t have a protector, they ejected me for not recognizing an offense.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.17_0: Because they had done the robe-making procedure, the nun Thullanandā
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.18_0: if he knew that the legal procedure was not done and I had not been done; the intention that works took a group, a group, or an embryo;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.19_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.20_0: “How could Venerable Thullanandā revile the community in a rage?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.21_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.24_0: “... How could the nun Thullanandā do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.25_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.26_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.27.1_0: ‘If a nun reviles a group, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.8_0: the Sangha of nuns is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.10_0: if he knows that a legal procedure was not done, and he knows that the legal procedure is invalid and efficacy, then whether a legal procedure is finished, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.11_0: If she reviles several nuns, a single nun, or someone who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.12.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.13_0: if she is aiming at what is beneficial;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.14_0: if he is aiming at giving a teaching;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.15_0: if she is aiming at giving an instruction;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.17_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.18_0: The third training rule is finished.
